speaker: Alex
text: Hey everyone, welcome back to PRCast, the podcast where we break down what's actually happening in your Pull Requests. I'm Alex, and today we're looking at a PR from one of Microsoft's biggest public doc repos -- dynamics-365-unified-operations-public.

speaker: Alex
text: So, PR number 5163, titled MSM Copilot experiences, merged into main from a branch called ai-includes-updates. The author is lavanyapg, and this one is clean -- no review comments, no debates, just a straightforward addition. One file changed, 18 lines added, zero deleted.

speaker: Alex
text: Now, what did they actually add? A brand new include file -- copilot-sustainability.md -- that documents five Copilot features for Microsoft Sustainability Manager. And these are pretty interesting.

speaker: Alex
text: First up, Analyze Documents with Copilot. This lets you upload ESG-related documents and just ask Copilot questions about the content. Think of it as a chat interface for your sustainability reports. Pretty handy if you're drowning in compliance paperwork.

speaker: Alex
text: Second, Create Calculation Models with Copilot. You describe what calculation model you want in plain language, and Copilot generates it for you. This is the kind of feature that saves hours of manual configuration. You enable it in Application Settings and access it from the Models page.

speaker: Alex
text: Third is Generate Reports with Copilot. This one handles emissions reports and CSRD reports -- that's the Corporate Sustainability Reporting Directive for those in the EU compliance world. You kick it off from the Copilot side pane.

speaker: Alex
text: Fourth, Query Data with Copilot. Instead of digging through dashboards, you just ask Copilot -- what's the revenue for this organizational unit? What's this assessment report metric? Natural language queries against your sustainability data.

speaker: Alex
text: And fifth, Find Facts with Copilot. This one is clever. It drafts qualitative and quantitative responses for ESG disclosures by scanning your uploaded documents and suggesting relevant facts. You review, edit, and add them to your reports. Basically an AI research assistant for sustainability compliance.

speaker: Alex
text: Now here's what I find interesting about this PR. It's not a code change -- it's documentation. But it tells us a lot about where Microsoft is pushing Copilot. They're going deep into sustainability and ESG compliance, which is a massive market right now. Every publicly traded company needs this stuff, and having AI assistance for it is genuinely useful.

speaker: Alex
text: All five features are in preview, so they're not GA yet, but the fact that they're being documented in the public repo means they're close. Keep an eye on Sustainability Manager if you're in that space.

speaker: Alex
text: That's it for this episode of PRCast. One file, 18 lines, but a nice window into Microsoft's AI strategy for enterprise sustainability. See you in the next PR.
